body.p: To his Excellency Thomas E Bramlette Gov. of Kentucky_ The undersigned would respectfully represent that at the present (April) Term of the Breckinridge Circuit Court two judgments were rendered by said Court in favour of the Comlth against Theophilus C Leslie for $50 each for selling spirits to minors. The proof in the first case was that the consent of the Step Father & the Mother had been given but was not in writing as required by the Statute No question was permitted to go to the Jury but the fact of selling & the age of the young man & the consequence was a conviction. In the second case Defendant was prepared to make the same proof but knowing it to be inadmissable under the ruling of the Court he confessed the Judgt for $50_ We are satisfied that the Indictments had been gotten up in malice. These were the first ones of the kind ever found in this county & the Defendant acted in ignorance of the law. The minors were of one age & size & appearance that would have made it doubtful whether they were of age or not and under all the circumstances we feel satisfied that this is a proper case for execution Clemency. Wherefore we pray your Excellency to interpose in behalf of Deft to the extent authorised by law.

Apl 13th 1864
